Ad Text:
About the role
An exciting role with a industry-leading organisation currently exists in order to fill a key role in their team. This Senior Financial Analyst (FP&A) position will help provide insightful analysis into key performance trends that exist in order to drive the positive financial direction of the company. Initially this position will commence as a contract role, however there is the genuine view for extension and/or permanency.


The responsibilities 
Reporting direct to the Head of Finance and working within a large team, your main duties will include:
Budgeting & Forecasting
Financial Modelling; including building three-way models
Ensure the accuracy of the monthly financial statements including monthly variance analysis.
Management Reporting
Monthly forecast & Quarterly forecast in conjunction with Operations.
Review, report and communicate monthly and quarterly to key stakeholders.
Assist with Annual Budget Preparation.
Assist Budget Process in conjunction with Operations and Business Unit.
Ensure a positive and productive work culture within the team.
Provide key interface with operations and business unit managers for all accounting matters.
Assist the wider Finance Team and other relevant stakeholders with ad hoc projects when required.
The successful applicant 
Ideally, you will be a CA/CPA qualified accounting professional and will possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills as your ability to interact and engage cross-functionally within the business will be crucial to your success. Additionally, you will have very strong Microsoft Excel skills, be "hands-on" and feel confident working with large data sets. Previous experience working in a large, complex and dynamic organisation will highly regarded.


About the Client
Our client is an instantly recognizable name residing within their industry. With a diverse portfolio, they boast an array of well-known, household products & brands.

How to Apply
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Jamie Burgess on 0439 014 028 or jburgess@sharpandcarter.com.au, quoting Ref No JB8982.

The role requires an experienced Senior Business Analyst / Workday Functional Consultant to drive the HCM scope, manage requirements, have functional ownership, and provide policy guidance to create a fit-for-purpose solution.

As a Senior Business Analyst and certified Workday HCM Specialist, you will be instrumental in translating strategic objectives into practical Workday configurations.

You will:

Support the HCM functional requirements analysis and requirements documentation for the workstream.  
Translate requirements into Workday configurations.  
As a certified consultant, advise on design and solutions to support informed decision-making in the workstreams.  
Key Responsibilities
 
Functional Expertise and Solution Design

Provide Workday-specific techno-functional advice where needed.  
Assist in the completion of Workday workbooks.  
Accountable for the translation of requirements into configuration documentation and workbooks.  
Work with stakeholders to design the solution and ensure alignment with business needs.  
Provide strategic consultation on functional and organisational design. 
Complete Impact & Gap analysis and assessment to support decision-making with analysis and options papers.  
 Essential Criteria
 
Knowledge and Technical Capabilities

Workday Certification and 5+ years of experience implementing Workday HCM solution is essential (core, compensation, benefits, recruiting, talent, performance, learning, absence, time tracking, payroll).  
At least 5 years' experience as a senior business analyst.  
Functional Human Resources experience.  
Knowledge of both waterfall and agile methodologies and the application of business analysis practices within these frameworks.  
Extensive and demonstrated experience conducting analysis of business needs across a complex portfolio of initiatives and technical environment.  
 Skills and Attributes

Superior analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving skills and excellent oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills.      
Strong interpersonal skills, including a strong ability to communicate and influence effectively across the most senior levels of the organisation.

Category: Corporate Finance & Investment Banking (Banking & Financial Services)
Ad Text:
Senior Analyst, Investments Operating Model

At AustralianSuper, we truly care about our colleagues. We know work and life are intertwined. That’s why we support the diverse needs of everyone and have policies that enable us all to thrive and be truly flexible. We ensure diversity is celebrated for the opportunity it provides us all to learn and grow and deliver better outcomes for members.

Your New Role 

Are you ready to make a real impact in the Investments domain? 

As our new Senior Analyst, Investments Operating Model, you’ll be at the forefront of technology and operating model transformation, working across a wide range of asset classes and investment teams.  You’ll collaborate with stakeholders from a wide range of backgrounds, both internally and externally to formulate and deliver solutions that future-proof our organisation and protect the financial interests of our members.

You’ll leverage your broad understanding of technology solutions and architectures in Investments, with deep familiarity of the underlying architecture of platforms such as LUSID, Aladdin, Calypso, Bloomberg, iLevel or similar, together with strong understanding of Investment data flows, the different requirements of IBOR vs ABOR and both listed and unlisted assets. You’ll know how aggregated investment data views are built and set up robust, scalable operating models that support our strategic goals.

A researcher at heart, you’ll stay ahead of technology best practice by building strong relationships with vendors, competitors, and internal stakeholders. You’ll wear a project management hat to implement changes, drive continuous improvement, and ensure our operating model is agile, compliant, and ready for the future.

What You’ll Need

Broad understanding of technology solutions in the Investments domain, with hands-on experience across asset classes.
Familiarity with investment data flows, IBOR vs ABOR, and the architecture of platforms such as Aladdin, Calypso, Bloomberg, iLevel or similar.
A strong understanding of how risk is viewed in a large multi-asset manager environment and how to design future-proof technology and operating models.
Research-driven mindset, with a passion for staying abreast of technology best practice and industry trends.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to build relationships with vendors, competitors, and internal stakeholders.
Project management capability, able to implement changes that drive success and member value.
Experience working in Fund Management, Asset Management, Hedge Funds, or Investment Banking.
Tertiary qualification in business, commerce, finance, or a related discipline.
Team player, able to work effectively at all levels and influence others towards consensus.
Commitment to compliance, governance, and continuous improvement.
Creative, resilient, and collaborative approach, aligned with our Values and Members First culture.

Life at AustralianSuper 

AustralianSuper is committed to colleague development, and we support our people with ongoing learning, coaching and training, as well as career opportunities across our expanding global organisation. We offer generous leave entitlements and promote a blended working environment in which all roles can flex, and we’re happy to discuss what this looks like for you.

We cultivate a workplace that champions safety, respect, inclusiveness and diversity. We are committed to supporting our diverse workforce in a way that is inclusive and embraces diversity in all its forms. If you require any reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process or the role, please let our recruitment team know.

What’s Next 

If you’re ready to bring your energy, integrity, generosity of spirit and passion for excellent outcomes to a team that loves a challenge, apply now!

Australian or New Zealand citizenship or Australian permanent residency status is required.

Progress powered by purpose.

https://www.australiansuper.com/careers/candidate-privacy-notice

Agencies please note: this vacancy is being managed directly by AustralianSuper’s Talent Acquisition team. We will contact our preferred agency partners should we require additional support. Thank you.
